metadata.title: CVE-2011-5036 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Rack before 1.1.3, 1.2.x before 1.2.5, and 1.3.x before 1.3.6 computes hashvalues for form parameters without restricting the ability to trigger hashcollisions predictably, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (CPU consumption) by sending many crafted parameters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-5036` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librack-ruby - 1.4.1-1
librack-ruby1.8 - 1.4.1-1
librack-ruby1.9.1 - 1.4.1-1
ruby-rack - 1.4.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-rack package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.1-1').
